comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031007 Firebird/0.7
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031007 Firebird/0.7

When i open the latest builds of firebird i can't see any tab, and i have this
error in the js debugger
"Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Index or size is negative or greater
than the allowed amount"  code: "1" nsresult: "0x80530001
(NS_ERROR_DOM_INDEX_SIZE_ERR)"  location:
"chrome://global/content/bindings/tabbrowser.xml Line: 869"]"

i hope it helps

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open firebird
2.
3.

Actual Results:  
i have no tabs

Expected Results:  
showme some tabs

it's happened to me in all the latest builds of mozilla
i'm running 0.7 and it works fine, but the latests trunks don0't work

comments.author: javier@pentacorp.net
fredbezies@gmail.com
comments.creator: fredbezies@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Remove Tab Browser Extension if you have it installed.

Try with a blank profile, without Tab Browser Extension in it. If you have tabs,
so it is a Tab Browser Extension bug.

Also, do you use any 3rd party theme ? 

If so, try again, with official theme.

Thanks.
comments.text:
Remove Tab Browser Extension if you have it installed.

Try with a blank profile, without Tab Browser Extension in it. If you have tabs,
so it is a Tab Browser Extension bug.

Also, do you use any 3rd party theme ? 

If so, try again, with official theme.

Thanks.

comments.creator: fredbezies@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
So, no extensions. No 3rd party theme.

How did you install your firebird ?

Overwriting a previous one ?

Did you have the same behaviour with a blank new profile, using firebird profile
manager -> mozillafirebird -p

Thanks for your answers.

but, how can i do to use my old profile and have tabs?

thanx

ok, so i created a blank profile and the tabs are there, thanx for helping me

comments.author: javier@pentacorp.net

comments.creator: fredbezies@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
In your old profile (http://texturizer.net/firebird/edit.html to find it), when
firebird is closed, delete xul.mfl file, and chrome dir too.

If it is ok, just tell it here, and I will close this bug.

Sorry to say this to you but : you HAVE to upgrade your extensions too !

Firebird code is very different from version to version. So extensions coders
have to upgrade their code. Your error is related to a not-up-to-date extension.
